comment:
* Constants written into the Object Serialization Stream.
 *
 * @author  unascribed
 * @since JDK 1.1

variables.name: STREAM_MAGIC
variables.comment: * Magic number that is written to the stream header.

variables.name: STREAM_VERSION
variables.comment: * Version number that is written to the stream header.

variables.name: TC_BASE
variables.comment: * First tag value.

variables.name: TC_NULL
variables.comment: * Null object reference.

variables.name: TC_REFERENCE
variables.comment: * Reference to an object already written into the stream.

variables.name: TC_CLASSDESC
variables.comment: * new Class Descriptor.

variables.name: TC_OBJECT
variables.comment: * new Object.

variables.name: TC_STRING
variables.comment: * new String.

variables.name: TC_ARRAY
variables.comment: * new Array.

variables.name: TC_CLASS
variables.comment: * Reference to Class.

variables.name: TC_BLOCKDATA
variables.comment:
* Block of optional data. Byte following tag indicates number
     * of bytes in this block data.

variables.name: TC_ENDBLOCKDATA
variables.comment: * End of optional block data blocks for an object.

variables.name: TC_RESET
variables.comment: * Reset stream context. All handles written into stream are reset.

variables.name: TC_BLOCKDATALONG
variables.comment:
* long Block data. The long following the tag indicates the
     * number of bytes in this block data.

variables.name: TC_EXCEPTION
variables.comment: * Exception during write.

variables.name: TC_LONGSTRING
variables.comment: * Long string.

variables.name: TC_PROXYCLASSDESC
variables.comment: * new Proxy Class Descriptor.

variables.name: TC_ENUM
variables.comment:
* new Enum constant.
     * @since 1.5

variables.name: TC_MAX
variables.comment: * Last tag value.

variables.name: baseWireHandle
variables.comment: * First wire handle to be assigned.

variables.name: SC_WRITE_METHOD
variables.comment:
* Bit mask for ObjectStreamClass flag. Indicates a Serializable class
     * defines its own writeObject method.

variables.name: SC_BLOCK_DATA
variables.comment:
* Bit mask for ObjectStreamClass flag. Indicates Externalizable data
     * written in Block Data mode.
     * Added for PROTOCOL_VERSION_2.
     *
     * @see #PROTOCOL_VERSION_2
     * @since 1.2

variables.name: SC_SERIALIZABLE
variables.comment: * Bit mask for ObjectStreamClass flag. Indicates class is Serializable.

variables.name: SC_EXTERNALIZABLE
variables.comment: * Bit mask for ObjectStreamClass flag. Indicates class is Externalizable.

variables.name: SC_ENUM
variables.comment:
* Bit mask for ObjectStreamClass flag. Indicates class is an enum type.
     * @since 1.5

variables.name: SUBSTITUTION_PERMISSION
variables.comment:
* Enable substitution of one object for another during
     * serialization/deserialization.
     *
     * @see java.io.ObjectOutputStream#enableReplaceObject(boolean)
     * @see java.io.ObjectInputStream#enableResolveObject(boolean)
     * @since 1.2

variables.name: SUBCLASS_IMPLEMENTATION_PERMISSION
variables.comment:
* Enable overriding of readObject and writeObject.
     *
     * @see java.io.ObjectOutputStream#writeObjectOverride(Object)
     * @see java.io.ObjectInputStream#readObjectOverride()
     * @since 1.2

variables.name: PROTOCOL_VERSION_1
variables.comment:
* A Stream Protocol Version.

* * All externalizable data is written in JDK 1.1 external data * format after calling this method. This version is needed to write * streams containing Externalizable data that can be read by * pre-JDK 1.1.6 JVMs. * * @see java.io.ObjectOutputStream#useProtocolVersion(int) * @since 1.2

variables.name: PROTOCOL_VERSION_2
variables.comment:
* A Stream Protocol Version.

* * This protocol is written by JVM 1.2. * * Externalizable data is written in block data mode and is * terminated with TC_ENDBLOCKDATA. Externalizable class descriptor * flags has SC_BLOCK_DATA enabled. JVM 1.1.6 and greater can * read this format change. * * Enables writing a nonSerializable class descriptor into the * stream. The serialVersionUID of a nonSerializable class is * set to 0L. * * @see java.io.ObjectOutputStream#useProtocolVersion(int) * @see #SC_BLOCK_DATA * @since 1.2
